summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, regarding the immediate operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It discusses the need for agents to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The sender/forwarder of the email chain, coordinating the operational response from the FBI New York office.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning for Arrest
events.description: The FBI squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) in New York begins immediate planning to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019.
An arrest warrant was issued, and the FBI planned to take him into custody immediately upon his return to the United States.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and deploying agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.
The email indicates the investigation involved co-conspirators and required significant resources from the FBI's VCAC/Human Trafficking squad.
